example.name: intransitive
example.text: If [*-1] positioned over the brain 's motor-control area , the hand-held electromagnets generate nerve impulses that [*T*-309]zip down motor nerves and activate muscles , [*] making , say , a finger twitch .

roleset.name: shut a zippered closure
roleset.note: ZIP-V NOTES: Based on sentence in Bolt data. Comparison to zip_up. VN class tape-22.4. FN class closure. Framed by Katie. (from zip.03-v)

example.name: Non-literal zipper
example.text: She had shut her mouth tight and zipped it.

example.name: Silly John
example.text: John zipped one side of his jacket to the other side of Mary's.
example.arg: to the other side of Mary's

roleset.name: zip_up
roleset.note: ZIP_UP-V NOTES: VN updated by Julia, 9/2010. Related to Vncls tape-22.4 (well, actually, just 'zip' is. This sense sans 'up' will probably need to be added ad some point). Ditto FN. (from zip.02-v)

roles.note: 'zip up' probably won't occur with multiple arg1s, as just 'zip' may. (from zip.02-v)

example.name: must have thought he was a burrito
example.text: Jaime zipped up his sleeping bag right before getting eaten by a bear.
example.arg: right before getting eaten by a bear
